TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in LOC . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE .
The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON Jagander of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , when the applicant was DATE , she moved from her mother ’s house to an apartment of her own . At that time the applicant had finished school and had a temporary job as a trainee at a radio station . On DATE she lodged an application with ORG ( sociala distriktnämnden -hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) of GPE , requesting a supplementary social allowance under section CARDINAL of LAW ( Socialtjänstlagen , lag CARDINAL ) for her living expenses and for her rent .

On DATE the ORG rejected her request , finding that the applicant ’s mother , who stood surety for the applicant on her rental contract , could provide for her needs or else the applicant could return to live at her mother ’s home . She appealed against this decision to ORG ( länsrätten ) of GPE . Before transmitting the appeal to the court , the ORG , on DATE , reviewed its decision without , however , coming to a different conclusion .

By a judgment of DATE ORG found for the applicant . It observed that , since she had attained the age of majority and was not studying anymore , her parents were not obliged to support her financially . Moreover , her trainee salary did not give her a reasonable standard of living .

The ORG appealed against the judgment to ORG ( kammarrätten ) of GPE and also requested it to stay the enforcement of ORG judgment , which was granted on DATE . On DATE , after having held an oral hearing on DATE , ORG overturned the lower court ’s decision and upheld the ORG ’s rejection .

On DATE the applicant submitted an appeal to ORG ( regeringsrätten ) which received it on DATE . The court noted that the case was not of an urgent nature since the social welfare assistance requested by the applicant concerned only the period from DATE ; thereafter the applicant had been able to support herself . Thus , the case was not given priority according to the court ’s rules of procedure .

On DATE ORG received another case involving a very similar issue . On DATE and DATE it received CARDINAL further such cases . It was decided that these CARDINAL cases and the applicant ’s case should be examined simultaneously , in order to ensure a uniform development of ORG case - law .

On DATE ORG granted the applicant leave to appeal and , on DATE , it ordered the ORG to submit its observations on the appeal . The ORG , by letter of DATE , contested the appeal . The court then , on DATE , invited the applicant to respond to the ORG ’s observations , which she did by DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s observations were transmitted to ORG .

On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment rejecting the applicant ’s request . The court found that her financial problems had started when she moved to an apartment of her own and that , at the relevant time , such a move had not been necessary in order to ensure her a reasonable standard of living . Therefore , the applicant was not entitled to social welfare assistance under section CARDINAL of LAW .
